originalText.text: Great and very prompt service and price was reasonable too. A friend of mine used to work here and I always went to her whenever I needed dry cleaning or clothing repairs and I was always pleased. Even though my friend no longer works here, I always still receive great service.  Thanks so much!

originalText.text:
Horrible unfriendly service from minute one I walked in even when I was a new client.
They over charged me with $28.50 for a ham that cost as per them $12 and to cut (takes 20 sec) two inside square pockets. No only they charge me $40.5 they didn‚Äôt clean the pants and I received as you see the photo below.
And this is nothing, I gave them a dress to change zipper only & no cleaning. Well guess what? I got the dress back with out change of zipper! at least they didn‚Äôt charge for thatüôå
When I call to complain the same young lady who need urgently a customer service training responded to my feedback defensively instead to provide a  problem solving approach and apologies.
I requested to speak with the owner, he called me back immediately but after he listened my complain ‚Äúagain‚Äù instead to apologies for the inconvenience & offer a solution, he start defending her employee.
I was very frustrated with the horrible low level of customer service and the most important the owner didn‚Äôt want to refund me the difference and suggested me to complain with the credit card.
This people are stealing money from other like me instead to work with honesty.
I recommend you to use other dry cleaners as this people are not trustful at all.
I hope this help to avoid more people to get scammed by a Business that will be reported to the authorities as should be.

originalText.text: I am extremely disappointed at the price hikes. Startled to see they charged $50 to hem my skirt. Now I find that my laundered linen shirts cost $20 apiece. My jacket's dry cleaning was $15. IT MAKES NO SESNSE. They overcharge and play it off like that's the standard NYC price. Absolutely ridiculous.

My jacket's dry cleaning was $15. IT MAKES NO SESNSE. They overcharge and play it off like that's the standard NYC price. Absolutely ridiculous.

originalText.text: Terrible customer service & insane prices.  Places in Manhattan charge for a fraction of the price and do a way better job.  Don't even bother.

text.text: Terrible customer service & insane prices.  Places in Manhattan charge for a fraction of the price and do a way better job.  Don't even bother.

originalText.text: Terrible Customer service. I gave them 3 shirts and 1 pair of pants for dry cleaning. When only the pants were returned I called to ask about my shirts. The initial response from the owner/manager was that they were delivered. When I told him that they were not, he started getting very rude claiming that they never received my shirts and that I was only charged for the pants. I then checked my credit card transactions and they were clearly showing that I was charged for the pants AND the shirts.  Instead of offering an apology and trying to come up with a solution he kept insisting that I never gave them my shirts. The following day they left me a dry voice message confirming that they actually did receive my shirts. They lost my business, that‚Äôs for sure.
